alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 7:59PM MST until December 22 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills of 20 to 30 degrees below zero expected. * WHERE...La Crosse, Uniontown, Potlatch, Moscow, Plummer, Genesee, Tekoa, Pullman, Colfax, Oakesdale, and Rosalia. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 7 PM Wednesday to Noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
